page.title: 03FARMING IN 1911
page.content: A long time ago{farming}was very hard because there were no tractors or combine harvesters.Everything had to be done with horses or by hand. On the{Waltness}farm there were six {Clydesdale}horses altogether.Two men looked after them. Every day for an hour they were groomed and had fresh bedding. {Farm servants had to get up at 5am. Breakfast was at 6am before going out to work in the fields. At 11am they fed the cows. The men got dinner of tatties pork and kale at 11.30am A lot of turnips were grown on the farm for the animals and the people.Most of them were sent to Shetland. {The main crop was oats or bere}to be ground in the mill at{Elwick.}The farmer always kept a big pig fattened up.They also had a lot of hens.
